result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy W. Allington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs: Paid in full. $443.00 was collecting by Clerk of Courts on 11/7/16.  
Chk#6803 for $267.00 was paid to DOC on 12/9/16
$61.71 was collected by DOC and sent to Clerk of Court. Chk#7041 for $61.71 sent to DOC on 8/23/17.

Provide DNA sample.
Agent will look at referring Defendant to the VA for an assessment. 
Follow through with any treatment recommendation.
Comply with any conditions imposed by Agent.

timeConds.notes: Stayed. Defendant does not have to serve if he gets a VA assessmet and completes any treatment recommendation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy W. Allington

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

Probation review hearing on October 30, 2017 at 11:45 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: 11:43  This includes 16CM92Defendant Jeremy W. Allington in court.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  16CM73  amend to ord violation 176-1 $210.80 forf.   16CM92 Plead to charge Probation 1 year. Cond of 7 days jail with huber.  Court costs, DNA sample and surcharge.  Judge reviews the waiver of right to attorney with the defendant. Defendant was a member of the military.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights Defendant waives his right to an attorney. Court approves the waiver on attorney.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is reviewed with Def by the Judge.   DEF PLEADS GUILTYto the charge in 16CM92 Fact establish a sufficient basis to find defendant guilty.   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of the charge in 16CM92  16CM73 court grants motion to amend to ord violation 176-1    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to the amended charge.   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty  $210.80 forf which will be paid today.    Court orders 16CM92 S/W Probation 1 year.  Cond: Court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Agent will look at referring defendant to the VA for an assessment. 10 days jail stayed - if the defendant gets the VA assessment and completes any treatment recomendation the defendant will not served the 10 days. The DA will fine an amended criminal complaint to  "otherwise disorderly conduct".
Plea hearing on October 31, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Final pre-trial on August 16, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial on September 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

10:25 Defendant Jeremy W. Allington in court.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CM92 heard at this time. Court gives constitutional rights to the court room as a group. Each Defendant in a group exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.  Defendant has copy of complaints.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint. Def pleas not guilty to both cases. Court rec/enter plea. Froelich: 16CM92 $2000 signature bond. 16CM73 $2000 signature bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on May 26, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
